  • Deprecated Methods
    Method
    Description
    org.glassfish.jersey.internal.guava.Iterators.emptyIterator()
    Use ImmutableSet.<T>of().iterator() instead; or for Java 7 or later, Collections.emptyIterator(). This method is scheduled for removal in May 2016.
    org.glassfish.jersey.internal.guava.LoadingCache.apply(K)
    Provided to satisfy the Function interface; use LoadingCache.get(K) or #getUnchecked instead.
    org.glassfish.jersey.internal.guava.UnmodifiableIterator.remove()
    Unsupported operation.
    org.glassfish.jersey.internal.guava.UnmodifiableListIterator.add(E)
    Unsupported operation.
    org.glassfish.jersey.internal.guava.UnmodifiableListIterator.set(E)
    Unsupported operation.

    org.glassfish.jersey.internal.util.collection.DataStructures.createLinkedTransferQueue()
    org.glassfish.jersey.message.internal.AbstractMessageReaderWriterProvider.getCharset(MediaType)
    use ReaderWriter.getCharset(m) instead
    org.glassfish.jersey.message.internal.AbstractMessageReaderWriterProvider.readFromAsString(InputStream, MediaType)
    use ReaderWriter.readFromAsString(in, type) instead
    org.glassfish.jersey.message.internal.AbstractMessageReaderWriterProvider.writeTo(InputStream, OutputStream)
    use ReaderWriter.writeTo(in, out) instead.
    org.glassfish.jersey.message.internal.AbstractMessageReaderWriterProvider.writeTo(Reader, Writer)
    use ReaderWriter.writeTo(in, out) instead.
    org.glassfish.jersey.message.internal.AbstractMessageReaderWriterProvider.writeToAsString(String, OutputStream, MediaType)
    use ReaderWriter.writeToAsString(s, out, type) instead
    org.glassfish.jersey.message.internal.HeaderUtils.asString(Object)
    org.glassfish.jersey.message.internal.HeaderUtils.asStringHeaders(MultivaluedMap<String, Object>)
    org.glassfish.jersey.message.internal.HeaderUtils.asStringHeadersSingleValue(MultivaluedMap<String, Object>)
    org.glassfish.jersey.message.internal.HeaderUtils.asStringList(List<Object>)
    org.glassfish.jersey.message.internal.HeaderUtils.checkHeaderChanges(Map<String, String>, MultivaluedMap<String, Object>, String)
